items.title: Were the Israeli-US strikes on Iran legal under international law? These experts say no
items.summary: The government's refusal to publicly assess the legality of the strikes risks "trashing" international law, an expert says.

items.title: 'We knew it would be worse': Bobbi left Florida, her dog and Trump for a tiny Australian town
items.summary: Bobbi Waterman didn't feel safe as a trans woman in the US. In Rupanyup, Victoria, she and her spouse have built a community for themselves.

items.title: Hanad lives in hiding, fearing deportation. This is life during Trump's immigrant crackdown
items.summary: In Minnesota, ICE agents have left behind a trail of trauma, with members of the Somali community still living in hiding.

items.title: In pictures: Colour, protest and pride at this year's Sydney Mardi Gras
items.summary: Chants of both pride and protest echoed around Sydney as thousands of people marched along Oxford Street for the annual Mardi Gras parade.

items.title: Wong warns Australians in Middle East of 'difficult days ahead' as flights cancelled
items.summary: Some believe that Middle East airspace could be "shut for quite some time" amid the latest conflict between the US, Israel and Iran.

items.title: Albanese to convene security committee as he backs US action against Iran
items.summary: The prime minister lashed the Iranian regime and said it "can never be allowed to develop a nuclear weapon".

items.title: The 'ISIS bride' who was rendered stateless and couldn't return home
items.summary: In recent years, Shamima Begum said she lived in a dusty tent, unable to leave, with an "indefinitely" similar future ahead of her.

items.title: Taliban says it's open to talks after Pakistan bombs Kabul and other Afghan towns
items.summary: As the hostilities between Pakistan and Afghanistan are increasing, the Taliban officials say they "want to resolve this matter through dialogue".

items.title: US and Israel attack Iran as it vows to 'respond decisively' — as it happened
items.summary: The attacks came despite US-Iran talks aimed at ending a longstanding dispute over the regime's nuclear program.

items.title: As Mardi Gras gets underway, hundreds of LGBTQI+ refugees are seeking asylum in Australia
items.summary: With resettlement options collapsing worldwide, a new community-led initiative will help LGBTQI+ people get to safety in Australia.

items.title: A troubling new record as Australians' financial woes surge
items.summary: Last year, a record 111,373 Australians lodged complaints with the financial watchdog — a 14 per cent rise from 2024.

items.title: 'Fractured trust': Veteran Navy officer sacked from multicultural board after Israel posts
items.summary: Mona Shindy was dumped by Multicultural NSW from its advisory board this week after she shared posts on LinkedIn about Israel and Gaza.

items.title: Pakistan says it's in 'open war' with Afghanistan after launching airstrikes in multiple cities
items.summary: It comes after months of clashes between the two neighbours along the frontier.

items.title: 'Tip of the iceberg': Australia faces a rising threat
items.summary: In a more polarised world, political threats and violence are on the rise — and Australia is not immune.

items.title: Larrakia Elder arrested amid protests over controversial NT Administrator swearing-in
items.summary: Larrakia man Eric Fejo has been arrested at a protest opposing the swearing-in of NT Administrator David Connolly, following months of controversy around his selection for the role.

items.title: 'Significant progress' made during US and Iran talks — but no sign of a deal yet
items.summary: The discussions about the decades-long dispute over Iran's nuclear work come amid growing tension in the Middle East.

items.title: Sussan Ley won't return to parliament for farewell but is 'proud' of leadership milestone
items.summary: Becoming the first woman to lead any federal Opposition in Australia was "a milestone for all women to be proud of", Ley said.

items.title: I run a gay sauna in Australia. You'd be surprised who comes through the door
items.summary: Once stigmatised — and illegal — gay saunas like the one Glenn McNamara runs hold a special place in LGBTQI+ history.

items.title: Magda Szubanski says she's in remission after completing chemotherapy for cancer
items.summary: The comedian said she was "eternally grateful" to her medical team and those who've wished her well over the past nine months.

items.title: Clinton says she doesn't recall ever meeting Epstein, has no information about his crimes
items.summary: "I do not recall ever encountering Mr Epstein ... I have nothing to add to that," the former first lady said.

items.title: Last-minute apology for 'racist' posts 'doesn't change anything' for NT administrator, Elder says
items.summary: The incoming administrator's apology for widely criticised social media posts has not been accepted by some of his critics.

items.title: Your guide to the Women's Asian Cup 2026, as the Matildas chase redemption
items.summary: The Matildas will be hoping for a better result at the home tournament, after a shock early exit last time around.

items.title: Dateline returns with stories of the people caught in Trump's immigration crackdown
items.summary: Dateline's new season sees reporter Darren Mara meet ordinary Minnesotans who've found themselves at the heart of US President Donald Trump's crackdown on immigration.

items.title: 'They all had the same request': Strikes hit Fariba's hometown in Iran. Then came the messages
items.summary: Iranian-Australians describe a "mixed bag" of emotions after supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, was killed in US-Israeli strikes.
